description: HACCP System Requirements covering the development, implementation, and execution of HACCP plans. This module addresses team formation, hazard analysis, critical control points (CCPs), monitoring procedures, corrective actions, and on-floor execution of HACCP protocols.
scope: This module will always be applicable to all facility operations. Auditees have the option to present combined HACCP and Preventive Control Systems, but auditors must report/score separately.

submodules.name: Execution of the HACCP Plan on the Plant Floor

sections.title: Title & Document Control
sections.contentGuidance: Document identification (number, title, version, dates), approval signatures, distribution list

sections.title: Purpose / Objective
sections.contentGuidance: Why this HACCP document exists, what it achieves for food safety, business and compliance drivers

sections.title: Scope
sections.contentGuidance: What processes/products covered, facility operations included, who is responsible, any exclusions

sections.title: Definitions & Abbreviations
sections.contentGuidance: HACCP-specific terminology (CCP, critical limit, verification, validation, etc.), minimum 5-8 terms

sections.title: HACCP Team & Responsibilities
sections.contentGuidance: HACCP team leader, team members with qualifications, training requirements, specific responsibilities

sections.title: Product Description & Intended Use
sections.contentGuidance: Complete product description, ingredients, processing characteristics, distribution method, intended use, target consumer

sections.title: Process Flow Diagram
sections.contentGuidance: Detailed flow chart of all process steps, on-site verification statement, diagram validation records

sections.title: Hazard Analysis (Principle 1)
sections.contentGuidance: Comprehensive hazard analysis for biological, chemical, physical hazards at each step, likelihood of occurrence, severity assessment, control measures

sections.title: Critical Control Points - CCPs (Principle 2)
sections.contentGuidance: CCP determination using decision tree, justification for each CCP, documentation of logic applied

sections.title: Critical Limits (Principle 3)
sections.contentGuidance: Specific critical limits for each CCP, validation documentation supporting limits, scientific/regulatory basis

sections.title: Monitoring Procedures (Principle 4)
sections.contentGuidance: What to monitor, how to monitor, frequency of monitoring, who is responsible, monitoring equipment and calibration

sections.title: Corrective Actions (Principle 5)
sections.contentGuidance: Specific corrective action procedures when critical limits are exceeded, deviation handling, affected product disposition, process control restoration

sections.title: Verification Procedures (Principle 6)
sections.contentGuidance: Verification activities and schedules for each CCP, calibration procedures, record review frequency, validation studies

sections.title: Record Keeping (Principle 7)
sections.contentGuidance: HACCP plan documentation, CCP monitoring records, corrective action records, verification records, retention periods

sections.title: HACCP Plan Review & Maintenance
sections.contentGuidance: Annual review requirements, review when significant changes occur, plan modification procedures

sections.title: Training & Implementation
sections.contentGuidance: HACCP principles training for all workers, specific CCP operator training, training documentation, competency assessment

sections.title: Compliance Crosswalk
sections.contentGuidance: Table mapping Primus Code | Requirement | Document Section | Evidence

sections.title: Revision History & Approval Signatures
sections.contentGuidance: Revision table (version, date, description) and signature lines (HACCP Team Leader, Food Safety Manager, QA Manager, General Manager)
